text: Lonnie Melvin "Mel" Tillis (August 8, 1932 - November 19, 2017) was an American country music singer and songwriter. He recorded songs since the late 1950s. His biggest success occurred in the 1970s, with a long list of Top 10 hits. His biggest hits include "I Ain't Never", "Good Woman Blues", and "Coca- Cola Cowboy". == Awards and recognitions == On February 13, 2012, President Barack Obama awarded Tillis the National Medal of Arts for his contributions to country music. He also has won the CMA Awards' most coveted award, Entertainer of the Year. He was also known for his stutter, which does not affect his singing voice. His daughter is country music singer Pam Tillis. Tillis died on November 19, 2017 of respiratory failure complicated by sepsis in Ocala, Florida at the age of 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Mel Tillis at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum Category:1932 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from sepsis Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:Disease-related deaths in Florida Category:Country musicians from Florida Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American guitarists Category:Singers from Florida Category:Writers from Tampa, Florida
title: Mel Tillis
